page.title: 03River Annan
page.content: At Mr Robinson's Distillery Farm, we spoke to a farmworker who told us that sea trout were caught but that the season was now finished. The season actually lasts from February to November. It's very expensive to get a licence to fish in the river. He told us how the By_pass would affect the farm. It will cut 14 acres off the land. A bridge would be put over a part of the river nearby and builders work etc. would mean that the land might have to be resown in places.The coll on the river would be rebuilt, but it was meant to be rebuilt a year ago. Chapelcross Power Station takes millions of gallons of water from the river every year. We found out that this part of the river belongs to the Saville Estates of London.
